Text.Text: You *dare* defile our temple in the midst of our venerations to Sseth?!  Your death in the pit will be a lingering one, intruder!
Ssethssar!  Kill this intruder in the name of the World Serpent!
You *dare* interrupt us in the midst of our venerations to Sseth?!  Answer me, initiate, and pray your words keep you from the knife.
You *dare* interrupt us again?!  You had best carry word from Sseth himself, initiate, or I will flay the skin from your bones!
BLANK
Very well, your trespass is forgiven... this time.  Return to the feeding grounds and do *not* disturb us again, or you will join the heartless dead within the pit.  Now go!
You compound your trespass with a request to seek the *Guardian?*  In Sseth's name, I will *send* you to join him, initiate.  Ssethssar, kill this warmblood!
I *told* you we would deal with the matter, now... wait... ah, I see the nature of your trick, warmblood.  Seek to deceive the children of Sseth, do you?  Ssethssar, kill this liar!
Now you initiates -  you are not permitted here.  We will investigate this matter and kill the intruders - return to the feeding grounds and do *not* disturb us again.
How is it that you have made it this far without being detected?  You are as silent as Sseth's wings, intruder... but hiding in the shadows will protect you no longer.
Spare me your philosophical ponderings, outsider - state your *intent.*  You want something from me, or you would have attacked already.
Kuldahar?  Ah... the town beneath the great tree in the lands where our blood runs cold.

I have heard the petition of our cousins to the North... the half-breed, Jeszrael, from Dragon's Eye.  She has asked us for our aid in putting your kind to the blade... and taking back the lands that were once ours.

Jeszrael burns with hatred, as sweet as Sseth's venom... but I have yet given her no answer.  I told her I would meditate upon the matter... and in the centuries I have lived in Sseth's keeping has taught me patience, something Jeszrael too, must learn.

And abandon our people who have made their homes within the flames of Dragon's Eye?  You would have a greater chance of surviving the embrace of the World Serpent, outsider... we do not betray our race to ones such as you.

You compound your insult of abandoning my people with the abandonment of the lands which are rightfully *ours?*  No, we shall never surrender to you filthy outworlders, and we shall *take* what is ours...
Sseth has *brought* you to me, I see that now... you were a test.  Where once I hesitated, your insults have struck a flame in my heart.
I will aid our brethren in Dragon's Eye, and I will see your kind become our slaves, as Sseth has foretold.  I will place your heart upon the altar, and offer it up to the World Serpent.
Do you take me for a fool, outsider?  You are nothing but outworlder thieves, come to rob the temple of Sseth of its wealth... and the fate of thieves is to die in Sseth's coils.
You invade my chambers then expect to crawl back the way you came?  No, your only destination now is the pit... after I offer up your heart to the glory of the World Serpent.
Why have you come to my private chambers, initiate?  It is in this sanctuary alone that I may meditate and commune with Sseth.  Please... join the other initiates in feasting to the south.

Ah... I was wondering how long it would take your people to turn loose assassins upon us.  You have come a long way... all for nothing.  You cannot hope to stand against us here, in Sseth's holy ground.
Enough... my time is precious, initiate, and there are matters I must attend you elsewhere.  Join the initiates in feasting to the south and we shall speak again later.
Your questions will keep... and I am sure I will have many questions for you when we speak again.  For now, meditate upon what you have already been told and think on how you may serve Sseth.
Again you interrupt my meditations, initiate.  I have told you that these are my private chambers.  You must depart... now.

I am Ojaiha of the Gleaming Scales, the first under Sseth's shadow in this place... it is strange you would not know me, initiate.  Your teachers have been negligent... and may need to be disciplined.
As do we all, initiate... for in Sseth's glory our empire shall be restored and our enemies shall delivered unto Sseth.

The temple is an ancient structure, many times one of your lives, initiate.  It is older than my centuries, and it shall stand many centuries more... as long as we follow Sseth's teachings and carry out his will, from the ritual chambers to the Inner Coils.

The Inner Coils are forbidden to you, initiate... do not let your path wander there, or you will find yourself at the mercy of the Viper's Fangs or the Coiled Cabal.  Ashra and Inhatri show no mercy to their students... and they will show none to you.

As the priests serve the will of Sseth, the Viper's Fangs are his teeth, and the Coiled Cabal are his wings.  The Viper's Fangs strike our enemies from the shadows, while the Cabal extends our reach into the ancient lore which will rebuild our empire again.

Your form forbids you from joining the Cabal... but you may find a place within the Fangs if your discipline is strong.  The Fangs take in races with forms such as yours, so that they may strike at the enemies of our people... without exposing the yuan-ti.

The heartless dead... they are sacrificial victims kept alive through Sseth's magic so that they might suffer beyond their lives.  We take their hearts, and leave them in torment... it is Sseth's will, and it is fitting.
It is Sseth's *will,* initiate.  It is not our place to question, it is our place to obey him... that is the only answer you need.
The stele that surround the altar at the top of the temple mark the boundary of the Guardian.  It is holy ground, a place of great power and reverence.
The Guardian is the heart of this temple, to be awoken at a time decreed by Sseth.  The Guardian has slept within this temple for thousands of years, safe, until ready to carry out Sseth's will.
They are linked, yes... but the portal and the Guardian are *not* your concern, initiate.
I do not recall having mentioned the emissary, initiate... why do you ask about her?

Her anger is like a flame... she has come from the portal from the Eye of the Dragon to enlist our aid in driving the enemy races from her home.  She serves a three-headed beast and has committed her people to that banner.
Yes, the sign of the Legion of the Chimera, but of this group I know little, and I wish to learn what I may first before we commit our forces.
You know of the Legion?  Explain yourself, initiate.
That place is none of your concern, initiate.  Be mindful of Sseth, not of doors closed to you.
Forgive me.  I did not mean to disrupt your rituals, but-
Your evil rites end here, creature.  Prepare to die!
We shall see who dies this day, serpent.
Very well, then.  If it's a battle you want...
If you're eager to die, then prepare yourself, serpent.
I have come to enlighten you in the ways of a *true* god, serpent... and burn your decayed religion from the face of Faerun.
We... seek the Guardian.
Your evil rites end here, creature.  Prepare to die!
We meant no interruption, we only sought to serve Sseth - we throw ourselves on your mercy.
It is no matter... it can wait for another time.  Farewell.
We... seek the Guardian.
Your evil rites end here, creature.  Prepare to die!
We meant no interruption, we only sought to serve Sseth - we throw ourselves on your mercy.
It is no matter... it can wait for another time.  Farewell.
Blank
Before we go, we... seek the Guardian.  Do you know where he might be found?
The intruders you seek are right here, serpent - prepare to die!
Very well.  Farewell.
Very well, then.  If it's a battle you want...
If you're eager to die, then prepare yourself, serpent.
Very well, then.  If it's a battle you want...
If you're eager to die, then prepare yourself, serpent.
Before we go, we... seek the Guardian.  Do you know where he might be found?
The intruders you seek are right here, serpent - prepare to die!
Very well.  Farewell.
Sometimes it is best not to fight darkness with light.
We seek only to serve Sseth, great one.  To prove our competence, we infiltrated your chambers.  Forgive our impertinence.
Hiding in the depths of this jungle will protect *you* no longer.  Prepare to face your judgment, serpent.
We did not travel within the shadows.  Blame the incompetence of your guards for our visit... and your death.
We have come to ask your intentions regarding Kuldahar.
We did not mean to disturb you.  Farewell.
We seek only to serve Sseth, great one.  To prove our competence, we infiltrated your chambers.  Forgive our impertinence.
I want nothing from you, serpent, except your death.
We have come to ask your intentions regarding Kuldahar.
We want nothing - only to leave.  Farewell.
And what was your answer?
Then that is all I need to know.  Prepare to die, serpent.
Could we convince you not to join with her forces?
Then we have arrived just in time.  Prepare to die!
Then perhaps you could allow them to return here, to the jungles of Chult.
We have nothing to discuss, then.  Prepare to die.
I attempted to reason with you, serpent... you leave me no other choice.
I think you and Sseth are going to meet each other a lot sooner than you think.
Enough of your threats, serpent.  Prepare to die.
We have actually come in Kuldahar's name.
I think you and Sseth are going to meet each other a lot sooner than you think.
We'll see about that, serpent.  Prepare to die!
Wait a moment - we have come to ask your intentions regarding Kuldahar.
I think you and the World Serpent are going to meet each other a lot sooner than you think.
Who are you?
Forgive us, great one.  We seek only to serve Sseth.
We wished to know more about the temple.
We have come to stop you, serpent.  Prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
Very well.  Farewell.
We'll see about that, serpent.  Prepare to die.
We will only fight if we need to... we have come to ask your intentions regarding Kuldahar.
I think you and Sseth are going to meet each other a lot sooner than you think.
But I had more questions I wished to ask...
I'm not done with you, serpent.  Prepare to die!
Very well.  We shall speak again later.
I'm not done with you yet, serpent.  Prepare to die!
Very well.  We shall speak again later.
Who are you again?
Sseth has brought us to you again, great one.   We only wish to serve his will.
Who are you again?
Sseth has brought us to you again, great one.
We wished to learn more about the temple.
Not before we deal with you, serpent.  Prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
Farewell, then.
The error is ours, not our teachers, great one.  We seek only to serve Sseth.
We wish to learn more about the temple.
If you are the high priest, then prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
I must take my leave.  Farewell.
Who are you again?
Who are you again?
We wished to know more about the temple.
You'll meet Sseth's glory soon enough, serpent.  Prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
I see.  Farewell.
The Inner Coils?
And how do the Viper Fangs and the Coiled Cabal serve Sseth's will?
Can you tell us about the heartless dead?
That ring of stones around the altar on the top of the temple... does it serve Sseth's will?
What are the Vault and the stones in the eastern chamber of the temple for?
What are the Vault and the stones in the eastern chamber of the temple for?
What do you know of the Guardian?
Do you know Jeszrael?
What do you know of the Guardian?
Do you know Jeszrael?
I doubt Sseth's influence will spread beyond these jungles... or your evil religion.  Prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
I see.  Farewell.

Do you know Jeszrael?
Spoken like a true coward.  I've heard enough from you, serpent.  Prepare to die.
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
I see.  Farewell.
You take their hearts?  Why?
You cut out their hearts and then they *still* suffer?  Why not just kill them?
You cut out their hearts and then they *still* suffer?  Why not just kill them?
Can you tell me how the Viper Fangs and the Coiled Cabal serve Sseth's will?

But it is our concern... we have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
Very well.  Farewell.
I have heard her name spoken within the temple.  Can you tell me about her?
How do the Viper Fangs and the Coiled Cabal serve Sseth's will?
Can you tell us about the heartless dead?

No reason.  Farewell.

I see.  Farewell.
I can tell you about the Legion of the Chimera... and they are not to be trusted.

What do you know of the Guardian?
What do you know of the Guardian?
Then I've come just in time to stop you.  Prepare to die!
We have come from Kuldahar and seek a way to close the crossroads.
I see.  Farewell.
We are emissaries from the town of Kuldahar, and we have seen the Legion of the Chimera.  If Jeszrael is allied with them, she does *not* serve Sseth's will.
How do the Viper Fangs and the Coiled Cabal serve Sseth's will?
Can you tell us about the heartless dead?
That ring of stones around the altar on the top of the temple... does it serve Sseth's will?
What do you know of the Guardian?
